issue.title: tvtropes.org
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Literature/DisneyFairies](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftvtropes.org%2Fpmwiki%2Fpmwiki.php%2FLiterature%2FDisneyFairies) ### Comment Username: @DandelionSprout > Fairly large placeholders on the right. It doesn't seem at the time of writing like https://github.com/easylist/easylist/issues/15123 will be fixed anytime soon, so I'm submitting it to you guys too since it's a pretty popular website. > > I propose `##.sb-fad-unit`, though I suspect the site devs have adopted the "fad/bad/tad" element naming pattern to bypass adblockers. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/Qp5VxZ9.png)

issue.title: stfly.me

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://stfly.me/5t6N3](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fstfly.me%2F5t6N3) ### Comment > this shorten URL recognizes the extension and won't let you use it without deactivating it ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/px2Up9t.jpg)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser extension v4.1.53 Browser: | Chrome Stealth mode options: | Hide your search queries,
Send Do-Not-Track header,
Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests,
Strip URLs from tracking parameters,
Self-destructing first-party cookies (4320),
Self-destructing third-party cookies (2880),
Hide your Referrer from third-parties Filters: | Ad Blocking:

issue.title: AdGuard breaks scrolling on Instagram

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

4.1.53

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome, Safari, Microsoft Edge

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://instagram.com

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. AdGuard breaks Instagram scrolling; ad removal makes the page jump back to a previous post and you can't scroll past it. Disabling AdGuard fixes the problem.

2. Can't show with screenshot, see attached screen recording

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7212610/226141501-1651b875-7792-45b4-8641-6dc4408308d1.mp4


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: You still have other rules enabled.

issue.title: github.com

issue.body:
